articles.description: Fenerbahce say Jose Mourinho is filing a lawsuit against Galatasaray after the rival club accused him of making racist statements.
articles.title: Jose Mourinho: Fenerbahce manager files lawsuit against Galatasaray after Istanbul derby

articles.description: Jos Buttler steps down as England's white-ball captain following his side's Champions Trophy exit.
articles.title: Jos Buttler steps down as England white-ball captain

articles.description: Australia qualify for the semi-finals of the Champions Trophy at the expense of Afghanistan after their match in Lahore is abandoned following heavy rain.
articles.title: Champions Trophy: Australia into semi-finals after match against Afghanistan abandoned following rain

articles.description: The UK is set to host the men's Tour de France Grand Depart in 2027, BBC Sport has learned.
articles.title: Tour de France: Great Britain set to host Grand Depart of men's race in 2027

articles.description: England prop Ellis Genge says he has been dumbfounded by criticism of the team's style in the wake of their one-point win over Scotland last weekend.
articles.title: Six Nations: Ellis Genge hits back at England's critics

articles.description: Lewis Hamilton says Ferrari still have work to do as his former Mercedes team-mate George Russell sets the pace on the final day of pre-season testing.
articles.title: F1 pre-season testing: Lewis Hamilton says Ferrari still have work to do to improve

articles.description: Eight-time Men's Ballon d'Or winner Lionel Messi says he "didn't enjoy" playing for French club Paris St-Germain during his two-year spell and was "unhappy."
articles.title: Lionel Messi: Argentine icon 'didn't enjoy' time at PSG

articles.description: Manchester United winger Alejandro Garnacho will "pay for a team dinner" after his reaction to being substituted against Ipswich.
articles.title: Alejandro Garnacho to 'pay for Manchester United team dinner' after reaction to being subbed

articles.description: What makes an FA Cup giant-killer? BBC Sport looks at some of Plymouth's heroes in the competition so far.
articles.title: Plymouth Argyle: Where FA Cup giant-killers are made

articles.description: Englishman Dale Whitnell celebrates a remarkable two holes-in-one in his round on day two of the South Africa Open.
articles.title: South Africa Open: English golfer Dale Whitnell hits two holes-in-one
